* the one found on CBTTAPE 429, file 300, member MURPHY              *
*                                                                    *
**********************************************************************
*
*
*                |l      _,,,---,,_
*          ZZZzz /,:.-':'    -.  ;-;;,
*               |,4-  ) )-,_. ,( (  :'-'
*              '---''(_/--'  :-')_)
*
* If not controlled, work will flow to the competent man ....
* .... until he submerges
*
*    (Another wisdom from the fortune cookie jar)
*
**********************************************************************
BSPFCOOK BSPENTER BASE=(R12),RENT=YES
         TITLE 'Symbols'
         GBLA  &COUNT
&COUNT   SETA  0
WCC      EQU   X'C3'                  , restore Kbd, reset MDT
SF       EQU   X'1D'                  , Start Field
SBA      EQU   X'11'                  , Set Buffer Address
IC       EQU   X'13'                  , Insert Cursor
RA       EQU   X'3C'                  , Repeat to Address
         TITLE 'Check the Environment'
         TESTENV                      , Are we TSO, Batch, or STC
         B     BRTABLE(R1)            , Branch to service routine
BRTABLE  DS    0F
         B     JOB                    , R1 = 0: This is a JOB
         B     STC                    , R1 = 4: This is an STC
         B     TSO                    , R1 = 8: This is a TSO User
         B     EXIT                   , R1 =12:  ????
         B     EXIT                   , R1 =16:  CICS as a JOB
         B     EXIT                   , R1 =20:  CICS as a STC
         B     EXIT                   , R1 =24:  CICS as a TSU
         B     EXIT                   , R1 =30:  CICS, as a ????
         TITLE 'STC : Use WTOs to show the little cat'
STC      DS    0H
         MVC   MYWTO,WTO              , move skeleton to WS
         LA    R8,HAEGAR              , point to little cat
         LA    R7,HAEGARL             , length of one line
         LA    R6,(HAEGARE-HAEGAR)/HAEGARL num of lines
         DO    FROM=(R6)
          BLANK WTOTEXT
          MVC   WTOTEXT+5(HAEGARL),0(R8)
          WTO   MF=(E,MYWTO)
          AR    R8,R7
         ENDDO R6
         WTO   ' '                    , output empty line
         BAL   R6,GETFCOOK            , get cookie from Jar
         TITLE 'STC: Show fortune cookie and trailer line'
         DO    WHILE=(CLI,0(R8),NE,X'FE')
          BLANK WTOTEXT               , clear the print line
          SR   R7,R7                  , clear workreg
          IC   R7,0(R8)               , R7 now has length of message
          BCTR R7,0                   , decrement for execute
          LA   R8,1(,R8)              , R8 now has addr. of msg proper
          MVC  WTOTEXT(*-*),0(R8)     , insert the message text
          EX   R7,*-6                 , via EX
          WTO  MF=(E,MYWTO)           , write the text
          AR   R8,R7                  , Get to next line
          LA   R8,1(,R8)              , Add 1 for the decrement above
         ENDDO (WHILE,CLI,0(R8),NE,X'FE')
         WTO   ' '
         BLANK WTOTEXT                , first initialize
         MVC   WTOTEXT(L'HAEGARE),HAEGARE
         WTO   MF=(E,MYWTO)           , Write the trailer
         WTO   ' '
         B     EXIT
         TITLE 'JOB : Allocate and open files as needed'
***********************************************************************
* Allocate SYSUDUMP DD if not already present                         *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
JOB      DS    0H                     , show fortune cookie in a job
         DEVTYPE SYSUDUMP,DEVTYPE     , is there a SYSUDUMP DD
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , if no DD statement
          MVC  TUSDPTR,DPARM01        , MOVE SVC99 parms to WS
          LA   R1,TUSDPTR+TUSDDDN-DPARM01   DDNAME TExt unit address
          ST   R1,TUSDPTR             , place into parmlist
          LA   R1,TUSDPTR+TUSDCLS-DPARM01   CLASS Text unit address
          ICM  R1,B'1000',=X'80'      , flag as "last parm"
          ST   R1,TUSDPTR+4           , put into parmlist
          LA   R1,TUSDPTR             , point to Text Unit Pointer List
          BAL  R14,DOSVC99            , now do DYNALLOC
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)
***********************************************************************
* Allocate FCOOKPRT DD if not already present                         *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
         MVC   MYDCB,FCOOKPRT
         DEVTYPE DDNAME,DEVTYPE       , is there a SYSPRINT DD
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , if no DD statement
          MVC  TUSPPTR,DPARM02        , move to reentrant storage
          LA   R1,TUSPPTR+TUSPDDN-DPARM02 put address of DDNAME
          ST   R1,TUSPPTR             , text unit into parmlist
          LA   R1,TUSPPTR+TUSPCLS-DPARM02 put address of CLASS text
          ICM  R1,B'1000',=X'80'      , unit into parmlist and flag
          ST   R1,TUSPPTR+4           , as last parameter
          LA   R1,TUSPPTR             , point to text unit pointers
          BAL  R14,DOSVC99            , Try DYNALLOC
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)
         SPACE 2
***********************************************************************
* Open FCOOKPRT                                                       *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
         MVC   MYOPEN,OPEN
         LA    R3,MYDCB               , point to the DCB
         USING IHADCB,R3              , tell assembler
         OPEN  ((R3),OUTPUT),MF=(E,MYOPEN)
         IF    (TM,DCBOFLGS,DCBOFOPN,Z) if file did not open
          WTO  'BSPFCOOK - DD statement for FCOOKPRT missing'
          B    EXIT                   , and just exit
         ENDIF (TM,DCBOFLGS,DCBOFOPN,Z) if file did not open
         TITLE 'JOB : Init print line and show the little cat'
         BLANK MYLINE,CC=C'1'         , clear line, set form feed
         LA    R8,HAEGAR              , point to little cat
         LA    R7,HAEGARL             , length of one line
         LA    R6,(HAEGARE-HAEGAR)/HAEGARL num of lines
         DO    FROM=(R6)
          MVC  MYLINE+10(HAEGARL),0(R8) insert into printline
          PUT  MYDCB,MYLINE           , write the record
          BLANK MYLINE                , clear the printline
          AR   R8,R7                  , add length to get to next line
         ENDDO
         BAL   R6,GETFCOOK            , get cookie from Jar
         TITLE 'JOB: Print fortune cookie and trailer line'
         DO    WHILE=(CLI,0(R8),NE,X'FE')
          BLANK MYLINE                , clear the print line
          SR   R7,R7                  , clear workreg
          IC   R7,0(R8)               , R7 now has length of message
          BCTR R7,0                   , decrement for execute
          LA   R8,1(,R8)              , R8 now has addr. of msg proper
          MVC  MYLINE+1(*-*),0(R8)    , insert the message text
          EX   R7,*-6                 , via EX
          PUT  MYDCB,MYLINE           , write the text
          AR   R8,R7                  , Get to next line
          LA   R8,1(,R8)              , Add 1 for the decrement above
         ENDDO (WHILE,CLI,0(R8),NE,X'FE')
         BLANK MYLINE,CC=C'0'         , first initialize
         MVC   MYLINE+1(L'HAEGARE),HAEGARE
         PUT   MYDCB,MYLINE           , Write the trailer
         B     CLOSE                  , and exit
         TITLE 'TSO : Erase the screen, then show the little cat'
TSO      DS    0H
         GTSIZE                       , get screen size info
         LTR   R0,R0                  , Is it 3270?
         BZ    NOCLS                  , BIF not
         MR    R0,R0                  , Screen end = Lines times Len
         BCTR  R1,0                   , Convert position to offset
         D     R0,=F'64'              , Module 64
         N     R1,=X'0000003F'        , Make absoultely certain
         MVC   SCRCNTL,SKLCNTL        , Moce skeleton to cmd buffer
         STC   R0,SCREND+1            , column offset mod 64
         STC   R1,SCREND              , row offset mod 64
         TR    SCREND,SCRPOS          , make 3270 buffer address
         TPUT  SCRCNTL,LSCRCNTL,FULLSCR,,HOLD   and send
NOCLS    DS    0H
         LA    R8,HAEGAR              , point to little cat
         LA    R7,HAEGARL             , length of one line
         LA    R6,(HAEGARE-HAEGAR)/HAEGARL num of lines
         DO    FROM=(R6)
          TPUT (R8),(R7),R            , show one line
          AR   R8,R7                  , add length to get to next line
         ENDDO                        , loop around
         BAL   R6,GETFCOOK            , get cookie from Jar
         TITLE 'Display fortune cookie and trailer line'
         DO    WHILE=(CLI,0(R8),NE,X'FE')
          SR   R7,R7                  , clear workreg
          IC   R7,0(R8)               , R7 now has length of message
          LA   R8,1(,R8)              , R8 now has addr. of msg proper
          TPUT (R8),(R7),R            , Show the message
          AR   R8,R7                  , Get to next line
         ENDDO                        , and go around again
         LA    R7,1                   , first
         LA    R8,=C' '               , one space
         TPUT  (R8),(R7),R            , for s blank line
         LA    R7,50                  , length of trsiler text
         LA    R8,HAEGARE             , address of trsiler text
         TPUT  (R8),(R7),R            , show trailer
         LA    R7,1                   , now another
         LA    R8,=C' '               , space for
         TPUT  (R8),(R7),R            , a blank line
         B     EXIT
         TITLE 'Subroutines: DOSVC99 - Perform DYNALLOC functions'
DOSVC99  DS    0H                     , perform DYNALLOC functions
         ST    R14,DOSVSAVE           , save retrun address
         LA    R10,REQBLK             , point to request block
         USING S99RB,R10              , tell assembler
         XC    REQBLK,REQBLK          , clear RB
         MVI   S99RBLN,REQBLKLN       , set up length
         MVI   S99VERB,S99VRBAL       , indicate ALLOC function
         LR    R9,R1                  , point to Text Unit Pointerlist
         ST    R9,S99TXTPP            , put into Request block
         LA    R9,RBPTR               , Point to RB pointer
         USING S99RBP,R9              , tell assembler
         ST    R10,S99RBPTR           , st RB address into RB PTR
         OI    S99RBPTR,S99RBPND      , turn on high order bit
         LA    R1,RBPTR               , get addres of RB pointer
         DYNALLOC                     , issue SVC 99
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)
           XR  R14,R14
           ICM R14,B'0011',S99ERROR
           EX  R15,*
         ENDIF
         DROP  R9,R10                 , not needed any more
         L     R14,DOSVSAVE           , restore return address
         BR    R14                    , and retrun to caller
CLOSE    DS    0H
         LA    R3,MYDCB
         CLOSE ((R3)),MF=(E,MYOPEN)   , done with it
*        B     EXIT
EXIT     DS    0H                     , Leave
         BSPRET RC=0                  , and retrun with RC = 0
         TITLE 'Get pseudo random number from STCK and select cookie'
GETFCOOK DS    0H                     , Get random fortune cookie
         XC    DWORD,DWORD            , initialize
         MVC   MSG#(7),=CL7'ML'       , set msg prefix
         STCK  DWORD                  , get current time
         SR    R10,R10                , clear a work reg
         ICM   R11,7,DWORD+2          , get a part of the clock
         LA    R11,0(R11)             , clear high order byte
         D     R10,=A((ML00000-MLTBL)/4)  Divide by number of entries
         SLL   R10,2                  , remainder times 4
*                                     , R10 has offset into table
         LA    R9,MLTBL(R10)          , R9 now has address of text ptr
         L     R8,0(R9)               , R8 now has address of text
         BR    R6                     , return to caller
         TITLE 'LOGO and Constants'
         DS    0F
HAEGAR   DC    CL50'                                        '
HAEGARL  EQU   *-HAEGAR
         DC    CL(HAEGARL)'                                        '
         DC    CL(HAEGARL)'               |l      _,,,---,,_       '
         DC    CL(HAEGARL)'         ZZZzz /,:.-'':''    -.  ;-;;,    '
         DC    CL(HAEGARL)'              |,4-  ) )-,_. ,( (  :''-''  '
         DC    CL(HAEGARL)'             ''---''''(_/--''  :-'')_)    '
         DC    CL(HAEGARL)' '
HAEGARE  DC    CL(HAEGARL)'Another bit of wisdom from the fortune cooki-
               e jar '
SYSUDUMP DC    CL8'SYSUDUMP'          , for SVC 99
SKLCNTL  DS    0CL09                  , 3270 command string
         DC    AL1(WCC)               , Write control Character
         DC    AL1(SBA)               , Set Buffer Address Order
         DC    X'4040'                , RC = 01,01
         DC    AL1(IC)                , Insert Cursor Order
         DC    AL1(RA)                , Repeat Until Address order
SKLEND   DC    X'5D7F'                , Last position on screen
         DC    X'00'                  , Character to be repeated
LSKLCNTL EQU   *-SKLCNTL              , length of command string
SCRPOS   DS    0H                     , modulo 64 translate table
         DC    X'40C1C2C3C4C5C6C7C8C94A4B4C4D4E4F'
         DC    X'50D1D2D3D4D5D6D7D8D95A5B5C5D5E5F'
         DC    X'6061E2E3E4E5E6E7E8E96A6B6C6D6E6F'
         DC    X'F0F1F2F3F4F5F6F7F8F97A7B7C7D7E7F'
         TITLE 'Constants - Skeleton macros for reentrant codeing'
         DS    0D
WTO      WTO   '1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345-
               678961234567890123456789',MF=L
WTOL     EQU    *-WTO
FCOOKPRT DCB   DDNAME=FCOOKPRT,                                        +
               MACRF=(PM),                                             +
               DSORG=PS,                                               +
               LRECL=133,                                              +
               RECFM=FBA,                                              +
               BLKSIZE=1330
DCBL     EQU   *-FCOOKPRT
OPEN     OPEN  (,),MF=L
OPENL    EQU   *-OPEN
         TITLE 'Constants - Dynalloc text units'
***********************************************************************
* SYSUDUMP DYNALLOC parameters                                        *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
DPARM01  DS    0F
         DC    A(TUSDDDN)             , address of DDNAME
         DC    X'80'                  , end of list indicator
         DC    AL3(TUSDCLS)           , address of SYSOUT CLASS info
TUSDDDN  DC    AL2(DALDDNAM)          , key for DDNAME
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(8)                 , length od 1 entry
         DC    CL8'SYSUDUMP'          , contens of entry
TUSDCLS  DC    AL2(DALSYSOU)          , key for SYSOUT
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(1)                 , length of 1 entry
         DC    C'X'                   , sysout class
DPARM01L EQU   *-DPARM01
         SPACE 2
***********************************************************************
* FCOOKPRT DYNALLOC text units                                        *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
DPARM02  DS    0F
         DC    A(TUSPDDN)             , address of DDNAME
         DC    X'80'                  , end of list indicator
         DC    AL3(TUSPCLS)           , address of SYSOUT CLASS info
TUSPDDN  DC    AL2(DALDDNAM)          , key for DDNAME
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(8)                 , length od 1 entry
         DC    CL8'FCOOKPRT'          , contens of entry
TUSPCLS  DC    AL2(DALSYSOU)          , key for SYSOUT
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(1)                 , length of 1 entry
         DC    C'X'                   , sysout class
DPARM02L EQU   *-DPARM02
         LTORG
         COPY  BSPFCOO1               , ADCONS, part 1
         COPY  BSPFCOO2               , ADCONS, part 2
         COPY  BSPFCOO3               , cookies, part 1
         COPY  BSPFCOO4               , cookies, part 2
.TEST02  ANOP
         PRINT ON
         TITLE 'Workarea for Reentrant Code'
WORKAREA DSECT
DWORD    DS    D                      , resume DSECT
DOSVSAVE DS    F                      , save area for DOSVC
DEVTYPE  DS    6F                     , for DEVTYPE Macro
MSG#     DS    0CL7                   , number of fortune cookie
         DS    CL2                    , fixed header (ML)
WORK     DS    CL5                    , varying number
MYENV    DS    C                      , Environment indicator
MYWTO    DS    CL(WTOL)
WTOTEXT  EQU   MYWTO+4,79
MYDCB    DS    CL(DCBL)
MYOPEN   DS    CL(OPENL)
DDNAME   EQU   MYDCB+DCBDDNAM-IHADCB,8
MYLINE   DS    0CL133
MYCTLCHR DS    C
MYTEXT   DS    CL132
***********************************************************************
* 3270 datastream for clearing the screen                             *
***********************************************************************
SCRCNTL  DS    0CL09                  , 3270 command string
         DS    AL1                    , Write control Character
         DS    AL1                    , Set Buffer Address Order
         DS    XL2                    , RC = 01,01
         DS    AL1                    , Insert Cursor Order
         DS    AL1                    , Repeat Until Address order
SCREND   DS    XL2                    , Last position on screen
         DS    X                      , Character to be repeated
LSCRCNTL EQU   *-SCRCNTL              , length of command string
         DS    0F
TUSDPTR  DS    CL(DPARM01L)           , text unit pointers
         DS    0F
TUSPPTR  DS    CL(DPARM02L)           , text unit pointers
***********************************************************************
* SVC 99 Request Block                                                *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
RBPTR    DS    F                      , request block pointer
REQBLK   DS    CL(S99RBEND-S99RB)     , Request block
REQBLKLN EQU   L'REQBLK               , length of request block
         SPACE
         BSPEND                       , of module
./ ADD NAME=BSPFCOO1
         TITLE 'Table of message pointers and texts'
*********************************************************************
*        Printing has been turned off
*********************************************************************
         PRINT OFF
         DS    0F
MLTBL    DC    A(ML00000)
         DC    A(ML00001)
         DC    A(ML00002)
         DC    A(ML00003)
         DC    A(ML00004)
         DC    A(ML00005)
         DC    A(ML00006)
         DC    A(ML00007)
         DC    A(ML00008)
         DC    A(ML00009)
         DC    A(ML00010)
         AIF   ('&SYSPARM' EQ 'TEST').TEST01
         DC    A(ML00011)
         DC    A(ML00012)
         DC    A(ML00013)
         DC    A(ML00014)
         DC    A(ML00015)
         DC    A(ML00016)
         DC    A(ML00017)
         DC    A(ML00018)
         DC    A(ML00019)
         DC    A(ML00020)
         DC    A(ML00021)
         DC    A(ML00022)
         DC    A(ML00023)
         DC    A(ML00024)
         DC    A(ML00025)
         DC    A(ML00026)
         DC    A(ML00027)
         DC    A(ML00028)
         DC    A(ML00029)
         DC    A(ML00030)
         DC    A(ML00031)
         DC    A(ML00032)
         DC    A(ML00033)
         DC    A(ML00034)
         DC    A(ML00035)
         DC    A(ML00036)
         DC    A(ML00037)
         DC    A(ML00038)
         DC    A(ML00039)
         DC    A(ML00040)
         DC    A(ML00041)
         DC    A(ML00042)
         DC    A(ML00043)
         DC    A(ML00044)
         DC    A(ML00045)
         DC    A(ML00046)
         DC    A(ML00047)
         DC    A(ML00048)
         DC    A(ML00049)
         DC    A(ML00050)
         DC    A(ML00051)
         DC    A(ML00052)
         DC    A(ML00053)
         DC    A(ML00054)
         DC    A(ML00055)
         DC    A(ML00056)
         DC    A(ML00057)
         DC    A(ML00058)
         DC    A(ML00059)
         DC    A(ML00060)
         DC    A(ML00061)
         DC    A(ML00062)
         DC    A(ML00063)
         DC    A(ML00064)
         DC    A(ML00065)
         DC    A(ML00066)
         DC    A(ML00067)
         DC    A(ML00068)
         DC    A(ML00069)
         DC    A(ML00070)
         DC    A(ML00071)
         DC    A(ML00072)
         DC    A(ML00073)
         DC    A(ML00074)
         DC    A(ML00075)
         DC    A(ML00076)
         DC    A(ML00077)
         DC    A(ML00078)
         DC    A(ML00079)
         DC    A(ML00080)
         DC    A(ML00081)
         DC    A(ML00082)
         DC    A(ML00083)
         DC    A(ML00084)
         DC    A(ML00085)
         DC    A(ML00086)
         DC    A(ML00087)
         DC    A(ML00088)
         DC    A(ML00089)
         DC    A(ML00090)
         DC    A(ML00091)
         DC    A(ML00092)
         DC    A(ML00093)
         DC    A(ML00094)
         DC    A(ML00095)
         DC    A(ML00096)
         DC    A(ML00097)
         DC    A(ML00098)
         DC    A(ML00099)
         DC    A(ML00100)
         DC    A(ML00101)
         DC    A(ML00102)
         DC    A(ML00103)
         DC    A(ML00104)
         DC    A(ML00105)

         DC    A(ML00107)
         DC    A(ML00108)
         DC    A(ML00109)
         DC    A(ML00110)
         DC    A(ML00111)
         DC    A(ML00112)
         DC    A(ML00113)
         DC    A(ML00114)

         DC    A(ML00116)
         DC    A(ML00117)
         DC    A(ML00118)

*                                                                     *
*  RULES:                                                             *
*    1) DOUBLE QUOTES (") CAN BE USED AT ANY TIME IN THE TEXT         *
*    2) IF A SINGLE QUOTE (') IS USED IN THE TEXT THEN YOU MUST       *
*       USE TWO SINGLE QUOTES ('') TO GET ONE QUOTE.                  *
*    3) NO MORE THAN 79 CHARACTERS CAN BE DISPLAYED ON A LINE.        *
*                                                                     *
***********************************************************************

 FC '"Pseudocode can be used to some extent to aid the maintenance'
 FC 'process. However, pseudocode that is highly detailed -'
 FC 'approaching the level of detail of the code itself - is not of'
 FC 'much use as maintenance documentation. Such detailed'
 FC 'documentation has to be maintained almost as much as the code,'
 FC 'thus doubling the maintenance burden. Furthermore, since such'
 FC 'voluminous pseudocode is too distracting to be kept in the'
 FC 'listing itself, it must be kept in a separate folder. The'
 FC 'result: Since pseudocode - unlike real code - doesn''t have to be'
 FC 'maintained, no one will maintain it. It will soon become out of'
 FC 'date and everyone will ignore it. (Once, I did an informal'

ML02790  EQU   *
 FC 'HOW TO PROVE IT, PART 1'
 FC 'proof by example:'
 FC 'The author gives only the case n = 2 and suggests that it'
 FC 'contains most of the ideas of the general proof.'
 FC 'proof by intimidation:'
 FC '''Trivial''.'
 FC 'proof by vigorous handwaving:'
 FC 'Works well in a classroom or seminar setting.'
 DC X'FE'
ML02791  EQU   *
 FC 'HOW TO PROVE IT, PART 2'
 FC 'proof by cumbersome notation:'
 FC 'Best done with access to at least four alphabets and special'
 FC 'symbols.'
 FC 'proof by exhaustion:'
 FC 'An issue or two of a journal devoted to your proof is useful.'
 FC 'proof by omission:'
 FC '''The reader may easily supply the details'''
 FC '''The other 253 cases are analogous'''
 FC '''...'''
 DC X'FE'
ML02792  EQU   *
 FC 'HOW TO PROVE IT, PART 3'
 FC 'proof by obfuscation:'
 FC 'A long plotless sequence of true and/or meaningless'
 FC 'syntactically related statements.'
 FC 'proof by wishful citation:'
 FC 'The author cites the negation, converse, or generalization of'
 FC 'a theorem from the literature to support his claims.'
 FC 'proof by funding:'
 FC 'How could three different government agencies be wrong?'
 FC 'proof by eminent authority:'
 FC '''I saw Karp in the elevator and he said it was probably NP-'
 FC 'complete.'''
 DC X'FE'
ML02793  EQU   *
 FC 'HOW TO PROVE IT, PART 4'
 FC 'proof by personal communication:'
 FC '''Eight-dimensional colored cycle stripping is NP-complete'
 FC 'Karp, personal communication.'''
 FC 'proof by reduction to the wrong problem:'
 FC '''To see that infinite-dimensional colored cycle stripping is'
 FC 'decidable, we reduce it to the halting problem.'''
 FC 'proof by reference to inaccessible literature:'
 FC 'The author cites a simple corollary of a theorem to be found'
 FC 'in a privately circulated memoir of the Slovenian'
 FC 'Philological Society, 1883.'
 FC 'proof by importance:'
 FC 'A large body of useful consequences all follow from the'
 FC 'proposition in question.'
 DC X'FE'
ML02794  EQU   *
 FC 'HOW TO PROVE IT, PART 5'
 FC 'proof by accumulated evidence:'
 FC 'Long and diligent search has not revealed a counterexample.'
 FC 'proof by cosmology:'
 FC 'The negation of the proposition is unimaginable or'
 FC 'meaningless. Popular for proofs of the existence of God.'
 FC 'proof by mutual reference:'
 FC 'In reference A, Theorem 5 is said to follow from Theorem 3 in'
 FC 'reference B, which is shown to follow from Corollary 6.2 in'
 FC 'reference C, which is an easy consequence of Theorem 5 in'
 FC 'reference A.'
 FC 'proof by metaproof:'
 FC 'A method is given to construct the desired proof. The'
 FC 'correctness of the method is proved by any of these'
 FC 'techniques.'
 DC X'FE'
ML02795  EQU   *
 FC 'HOW TO PROVE IT, PART 6'
 FC 'proof by picture:'

 FC 'But the greatest Electrical Pioneer of them all was Thomas'
 FC 'Edison, who was a brilliant inventor despite the fact that he had'
 FC 'little formal education and lived in New Jersey. Edison''s first'
 FC 'major invention in 1877, was the phonograph, which could soon be'
 FC 'found in thousands of American homes, where it basically sat'
 FC 'until 1923, when the record was invented. But Edison''s greatest'
 FC 'achievement came in 1879, when he invented the electric company.'
 FC 'Edison''s design was a brilliant adaptation of the simple'
 FC 'electrical circuit: the electric company sends electricity'
 FC 'through a wire to a customer, then immediately gets the'
 FC 'electricity back through another wire, then (this is the'
 FC 'brilliant part) sends it right back to the customer again.'
 FC 'This means that an electric company can sell a customer the'
 FC 'same batch of electricity thousands of times a day and never get'
 FC 'caught, since very few customers take the time to examine their'
 FC 'electricity closely. In fact the last year any new electricity'
 FC 'was generated in the United States was 1937; the electric'
 FC 'companies have been merely re-selling it ever since, which is why'
 FC 'they have so much free time to apply for rate increases.'

ML04508  EQU   *
 FC 'Frobnicate, v.:'
 FC 'To manipulate or adjust, to tweak. Derived from'
 FC 'FROBNITZ. Usually abbreviated to FROB. Thus one has the saying'
 FC '"to frob a frob". See TWEAK and TWIDDLE. Usage: FROB, TWIDDLE,'
 FC 'and TWEAK sometimes connote points along a continuum. FROB'
 FC 'connotes aimless manipulation; TWIDDLE connotes gross'
 FC 'manipulation, often a coarse search for a proper setting; TWEAK'
 FC 'connotes fine-tuning. If someone is turning a knob on an'
 FC 'oscilloscope, then if he''s carefully adjusting it he is probably'
 FC 'tweaking it; if he is just turning it but looking at the screen'
 FC 'he is probably twiddling it; but if he''s just doing it because'
 FC 'turning a knob is fun, he''s frobbing it.'

ML04552  EQU   *
 FC '-- Gifts for Men --'
 FC 'Men are amused by almost any idiot thing -- that is why'
 FC 'professional ice hockey is so popular -- so buying gifts for them'
 FC 'is easy. But you should never buy them clothes. Men believe'
 FC 'they already have all the clothes they will ever need, and new'
 FC 'ones make them nervous. For example, your average man has 84'
 FC 'ties, but he wears, at most, only three of them. He has learned,'
 FC 'through humiliating trial and error, that if he wears any of the'
 FC 'other 81 ties, his wife will probably laugh at him ("You''re not'
 FC 'going to wear THAT tie with that suit, are you?"). So he has'
 FC 'narrowed it down to three safe ties, and has gone several years'
 FC 'without being laughed at. If you give him a new tie, he will'
 FC 'pretend to like it, but deep inside he will hate you.'
 FC 'If you want to give a man something practical, consider tires.'
 FC 'More than once, I would have gladly traded all the gifts I got'
 FC 'for a new set of tires.'
 FC '-- Dave Barry, "Christmas Shopping: A Survivor''s Guide"'

 FC 'alteration in the text. This he ordered printed at the beginning'

./ ADD NAME=BSPOSCMD 8000-74082-74082-1607-00586-00586-00000-HERC01
BSPOSCMD TITLE 'Execute operator commands from PARM and SYSIN'
*********************************************************************** 00213
*  This program will read a command from the PARM statement or a      * 00251
*  sequence of commands from SYSIN and execute them                   * 00253
*  Required DD statement: none                                        * 00266
*                                                                     * 00266
*  Optional DD statements:                                            * 00266
*           SYSIN    -  Input dataset for control statements          * 00266
*                                                                     * 00290
*           SYSPRINT -  Output dataset for messages etc               * 00266
*                       Default: SYSOUT=A                             * 00266
*                                                                     * 00290
*           SYSUDUMP -  Default: SYSOUT=A                             * 00266
***********************************************************************
         PRINT OFF,NOGEN
         COPY  BSPGLBLS
         COPY  BSPSGLBL
         DCBD  DSORG=(PS),DEVD=DA     , DCB layout
         IEFZB4D0                     , dynalloc dsects
         IEFZB4D2                     , and equates
         PRINT ON,NOGEN               , Macro expansion not needed
BSPOSCMD BSPENTER BASE=(R11),RENT=YES
         BAL   R14,ALCUDUMP           , allocate SYSUDUMP if needed
         BAL   R14,SETINIT            , initialize some variables
         BAL   R14,ALCPRINT           , allocate SYSPRINT if needed
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if allocated
          BAL  R14,OPNPRINT           , open SYSPRINT
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        ,
         BAL   R14,GETPARAM           , get parameter, if any
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if there was a parameter
          BAL  R14,ECHOLINE           , report the command executed
          BAL  R14,PROCLINE           , execute the command
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , there was a parameter
         BAL   R14,OPNSYSIN           , OPEN the SYSIN file if present
         TITLE 'Main processing loop'
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if open was okay
          DO FOREVER                  , Loop through all blocks
           BAL R14,GETLINE            , read one command
           BAL R14,ECHOLINE           , report the command executed
           BAL R14,PROCLINE           , process script line
          ENDDO                       , end of loop through member
         ENDIF
EXIT     DS    0H                     , end of data
         IF    (TM,PROCFLAG,HAVEPARM+HAVESYSN,Z)
          MSGPUT MSG03W
          BAL  R14,PUTMSG             , write last message
          SETMAXCC 4                  , set minimum RC
         ENDIF
         MSGPUT MSG99I                , insert message
         L     R15,MAXCC              , get return code
         CVD   R15,DBL                , make a number
         UNPK  MSG99I1,DBL+5(3)       , make printable
         OI    MSG99I1+L'MSG99I1-1,C'0'      last digit printable
         BAL   R14,PUTMSG             , write last message
         BAL   R14,CLOSYSIN           , close SYSIN if open
         BAL   R14,CLOPRINT           , close SYSPRINT if open
         L     R15,MAXCC              , get return code
         BSPRET RC=(15)               , and return with rc in r15
         TITLE 'Subroutines: PUTMSG - Display an error message'
***********************************************************************
* Routine to display an error message. The error message is assumed   *
* to be stored in the MSGTEXT area (and is at most 124 bytes long)    *
* The messages will be written to SYSPRINT DD if available and open.  *
* If not, the messages will be isssued via WTO                        *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on Entry: R14 = Return address                            *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
PUTMSG   DS    0H                     , output message on sysprint/wto
         STM   R14,R3,PUTMSAVE        , save registers
         IF    (TM,PROCFLAG,PRNTOPEN,O) SYSPRINT available?
          IF   (CP,LINENUM,GT,=PL2'55') end of page reached?
           MVC PRNTLINE,HEAD001       , Put in page header
           ZAP LINENUM,=P'12'         , reinit line number
           AP  PAGENUM,=P'1'          , increment page number
           MVC HEAD0011,=X'40202120'  , insert edit mask
           ED  HEAD0011-1(4),PAGENUM  , beautify page number
           PUT SYSPRINT,PRNTLINE      , write page header
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C1       , Insert LOGO1
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C2       , Insert LOGO2
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C3       , Insert LOGO3
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C4       , Insert LOGO4
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C5       , Insert LOGO5
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C6       , Insert LOGO6
          ENDIF
          BLANK PRNTTEXT              , erase any garbage
          MVC   PRNTTEXT(L'MSGTEXT),MSGTEXT
          PUT   SYSPRINT,PRNTLINE
         ELSE                         , no SYSPRINT, use WTO instead
          WTO  MF=(E,THEWTO)
         ENDIF
         XR    R15,R15                , clear RC
         ST    R15,PUTMSAVE+4         , set caller's RC
         LM    R14,R3,PUTMSAVE        , restore return address
         BR    R14                    , and return
         TITLE 'Subroutines: ALCUDUMP - Allocate SYSUDUMP if needed'
***********************************************************************
* Of course this program never has problems, but we allocated a       *
* SYSUDUMP DD for SYSOUT=A anyways                                    *
***********************************************************************
ALCUDUMP DS    0H                     , allocate SYSUDUMP
         STM   R14,R1,ALCUSAVE        , save registers
         MVC   TEMPDDN,TUSDDDNM       , insert DDNAME into msg text
         MVC   SVC99WA(TUSDLEN),TUSDPTR move text units to WS
         LA    R1,SVC99WA+TUSDDDN-TUSDPTR  point to DDNAME
         ST    R1,SVC99P1             , put into TU list
         LA    R1,SVC99WA+TUSDCLS-TUSDPTR  , point to CLASS parm
         ICM   R1,B'1000',=XL1'80'    , indicate last parm
         ST    R1,SVC99P2             , put into TU list
         LA    R1,SVC99WA             , point to work area
         BAL   R14,DOSVC99            , go and do it
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , Error on DYNALLOC?
          BAL  R14,PUTMSG             , tell the user
          SETMAXCC 4                  , indicate a problem
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , Error on DYNALLOC
         LM    R14,R1,ALCUSAVE        , restore registers
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
***********************************************************************
* SYSUDUMP DYNALLOC parameters                                        *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
TUSDPTR  DS    0F                     , text unit pointers
         DC    A(TUSDDDN)             , address of DDNAME
         DC    X'80'                  , end of list indicator
         DC    AL3(TUSDCLS)           , address of SYSOUT CLASS info
TUSDDDN  DC    AL2(DALDDNAM)          , key for DDNAME
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(8)                 , length od 1 entry
TUSDDDNM DC    CL8'SYSUDUMP'          , contens of entry
TUSDCLS  DC    AL2(DALSYSOU)          , key for SYSOUT
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(1)                 , length of 1 entry
         DC    C'A'                   , sysout class
TUSDLEN  EQU   *-TUSDPTR
         TITLE 'Subroutines: ALCPRINT - Allocate SYSPRINT if needed'
***********************************************************************
* Allocate SYSPRINT DD if not already present                         *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
ALCPRINT DS    0H                     , allocate SYSPRINT DD
         XR    R15,R15                , init return code
         STM   R14,R1,ALCPSAVE        , save the registers
         MVC   TEMPDDN,TUSPDDNM       , insert DDNAME into msg text
         MVC   SVC99WA(TUSPLEN),TUSPPTR move text units to WS
         LA    R1,SVC99WA+TUSPDDN-TUSPPTR  point to DDNAME
         ST    R1,SVC99P1             , put into TU list
         LA    R1,SVC99WA+TUSPCLS-TUSPPTR  , point to CLASS parm
         ICM   R1,B'1000',=XL1'80'    , indicate last parm
         ST    R1,SVC99P2             , put into TU list
         LA    R1,SVC99WA             , point to work area
         BAL   R14,DOSVC99            , go and do it
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , Error on DYNALLOC?
          BAL  R14,PUTMSG             , tell the user
          SETMAXCC 4                  , and end with RC=12
          ST   R15,ALCPSAVE+4         , set caller's RC
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , Error on DYNALLOC?
         LM    R14,R1,ALCPSAVE        , restore the registers
         BR    R14                    , and return to caller
         SPACE 2
***********************************************************************
* SYSPRINT DYNALLOC parameters                                        *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
TUSPPTR  DS    0F                     , text unit pointers
         DC    A(TUSPDDN)             , address of DDNAME
         DC    X'80'                  , end of list indicator
         DC    AL3(TUSPCLS)           , address of SYSOUT CLASS info
TUSPDDN  DC    AL2(DALDDNAM)          , key for DDNAME
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(8)                 , length od 1 entry
TUSPDDNM DC    CL8'SYSPRINT'          , contens of entry
TUSPCLS  DC    AL2(DALSYSOU)          , key for SYSOUT
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(1)                 , length of 1 entry
         DC    C'X'                   , sysout class
TUSPLEN  EQU   *-TUSPPTR
         TITLE 'Subroutines: OPNPRINT - Open SYSPRINT'
***********************************************************************
* Open SYSPRINT DD for output processing (for a job)                  *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
OPNPRINT DS    0H                     , open SYSPRINT
         STM   R14,R1,OPNPSAVE        , save registers
         MVC   SYSPRINT,SYSPRDCB      , move DCB to reentrant storage
         LA    R1,SYSPRINT            , point to SYSPRINT DCB
         BAL   R14,OPENFILE           , go open the file
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if successful
          OI   PROCFLAG,PRNTOPEN      , indicate that SYSPRINT is open
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if successful
         LM    R14,R1,OPNPSAVE        , restore registers
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
         PUSH  PRINT
         PRINT NOGEN
SYSPRDCB DCB   DDNAME=SYSPRINT,       , ddname for this file           -
               DSORG=PS,              , file is sequential             -
               LRECL=133,             , record length                  -
               BLKSIZE=1330,          , block size                     -
               MACRF=(PM),            , will be opened for output      -
               RECFM=FBA              , fixed block, ansi cntlchars
SYSPRLEN EQU   *-SYSPRDCB             , length of DCB
         TITLE 'Subroutines: OPNSYSIN - Open SYSIN'
***********************************************************************
* Open SYSIN DD for input processing (if present)                     *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
OPNSYSIN DS    0H                     , open SYSPRINT
         LA    R15,8                  , initialize return code
         STM   R14,R1,OPNSSAVE        , save registers
         DEVTYPE =CL8'SYSIN',DEVTYPE  , Check if SYSIN allocated
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if yes
          MVC  SYSIN,SYSINDCB         , move DCB to reentrant storage
          LA   R1,SYSIN               , point to SYSIN DCB
          BAL  R14,OPENFILE           , go open the file
          IF   (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if successful
           LA  R15,0                  , indicate success
           ST  R15,OPNSSAVE+4         , set caller's RC
           OI  PROCFLAG,SYSNOPEN      , indicate that SYSPRINT is open
          ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,Z)       , open was succesful
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , Test if SYSIN allocated
         LM    R14,R1,OPNSSAVE        , restore registers
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
         PUSH  PRINT
         PRINT NOGEN
SYSINDCB DCB   DDNAME=SYSIN,          , ddname for this file           -
               DSORG=PS,              , file is sequential             -
               LRECL=80,              , record length                  -
               BLKSIZE=80,            , block size                     -
               MACRF=(GM),            , will be opened for output      -
               RECFM=F,               , fixed block                    -
               EODAD=EXIT             , end of file address
SYSINLEN EQU   *-SYSINDCB             , length of DCB
         TITLE 'Subroutines: DOSVC99 - Perform DYNALLOC functions'
***********************************************************************
* Allocate a file to the current JOB/STC using SVC99.                 *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on entry:  R1 --->  Text Unit parameter list              *
*      field TEMPDDN:  DDNAME to be allocated                         *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on exit:   R15 = Retrun code                              *
*                        0 : Allocation successful                    *
*                  nonzero : RC from DYNALLOC call                    *
*      field MSGTEXT: error message text                              *
***********************************************************************
DOSVC99  DS    0H                     , perform DYNALLOC functions
         STM   R14,R3,DOSVSAVE        , save registers
         LR    R3,R1                  , point to Text Unit Pointerlist
         DEVTYPE TEMPDDN,DEVTYPE      , Test for DD card
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , if no DD card
          LA   R2,REQBLK              , point to request block
          USING S99RB,R2              , tell assembler
          XC   REQBLK,REQBLK          , clear RB
          MVI  S99RBLN,REQBLKLN       , set up length
          MVI  S99VERB,S99VRBAL       , indicate ALLOC function
          ST   R3,S99TXTPP            , put into Request block
          LA   R3,RBPTR               , Point to RB pointer
          USING S99RBP,R3             , tell assembler
          ST   R2,S99RBPTR            , st RB address into RB PTR
          OI   S99RBPTR,S99RBPND      , turn on high order bit
          LA   R1,RBPTR               , get addres of RB pointer
          DYNALLOC                    , issue SVC 99
          ST   R15,DOSVSAVE+4         , set caller's R15
          XR   R15,R15                , clear R15
          ICM  R15,B'0011',S99ERROR   , get error code
          ST   R15,DOSVSAVE+8         , place into caller's R0
          MSGPUT MSG01E               , insert message text
          MVC  MSG01E1,TEMPDDN        , insert DDNAME into message
          X2CHRTRN MSG01E2,DOSVSAVE+06,LEN=2
          X2CHRTRN MSG01E3,DOSVSAVE+10,LEN=2
         ELSE
          ST   R15,DOSVSAVE+4         , set caller's R15
          MSGPUT MSG20I               , set up message text
         ENDIF
         LM    R14,R3,DOSVSAVE        , restore return address
         BR    R14                    , and retrun to caller
         DROP  R2,R3                  , not needed any more
         TITLE 'Subroutines: SETINIT  - Initialize some variables'
***********************************************************************
* Initialze some variables, set processing options according to       *
* runtime environmaent (STC or BATCH)                                 *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
SETINIT  DS    0H                     , Initialize some variables
         STM   R14,R1,SETISAVE        , save registers
         XC    MEMCC,MEMCC            , return code field
         XC    MAXCC,MAXCC            , return code field
         XC    LASTCC,LASTCC          , return code field
         MVI   PROCFLAG,X'0'          , clear parm flag
         ZAP   LINENUM,=P'100'        , force page break
         ZAP   PAGENUM,=P'0'          , init page number
         TESTENV                      , STC? BATCH? TSO?
         IF    (CH,R1,EQ,=H'0')       , is this a batch job
          OI   PROCFLAG,ISJOB         , remember in process option flag
         ELSEIF (CH,R1,EQ,=H'4')      , is this an STC
          OI   PROCFLAG,ISSTC         , put indicator to flag
         ELSE                         , it is not supported
          BLANK MSGTEXT
          MSGPUT MSG14E               ,  insert message text
          BAL  R14,PUTMSG             , issue message
          SETMAXCC 12                 , get out with RC=12
          B    EXIT
         ENDIF
         LM    R14,R1,SETISAVE        , restore all register
         BR    R14                    , and return to caller
         TITLE 'Subroutines: GETLINE - Read a line from the SCRIPT'
***********************************************************************
*  This routine will read a record from the SYSIN file and place it   *
*  into PARMAREA                                                      *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
GETLINE  DS    0H                     , Build SCRPTLIN
         STM   R14,R1,GETLSAVE        , save the registers
         BLANK PARMAREA               , clear receiving buffer
         GET   SYSIN,PARMAREA         , read next record
         OI    PROCFLAG,HAVESYSN      , indicate at least 1 rec read
         LM    R14,R1,GETLSAVE        , restore the registers
         BR    R14                    , back to caller
         TITLE 'Subroutines: ECHOLINE - Echo the script line'
***********************************************************************
*  This routine will echo the script line to the console unless the   *
*  NOECHO parameter is set or the line is in a non-executed           *
*  conditional block                                                  *
*                                                                     *
*  Registers on ENTRY :  R14 = return address                         *
*                                                                     *
*  Registers on exit  :  unchanged                                    *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
ECHOLINE DS    0H                     , process the PARM statement
         STM   R14,R1,ECHOSAVE        , save registers
         MSGPUT MSG91I                , load message body
         MVC   MSG91I1,PARMAREA       , insert command text
         BAL   R14,PUTMSG             , send message
         LM    R14,R1,ECHOSAVE        , restore rgisters
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
         TITLE 'Subroutines: PROCLINE - Run the command via SVC34'
***********************************************************************
*  This routine will run the command which is in PARMAREA             *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
PROCLINE DS    0H                     , process the PARM statement
         STM   R14,R1,PROCSAVE        , save registers
         BLANK MSGTEXT                , Clear command text buffer
         MVC   THEWTO(2),=AL2(104)    , Load command length
         MVC   MSGTEXT(L'PARMAREA),PARMAREA insert command
         BSPAUTH ON                   , we are big boss now
         MODESET KEY=ZERO             , get to key 0
         SR    R0,R0                  , clear for SVC 34
         LA    R1,THEWTO              , point to command buffer
         SVC   34                     , issue command
         MODESET KEY=NZERO            , back to normal
         BSPAUTH OFF                  , no longer big boss
         LM    R14,R1,PROCSAVE        , restore rgisters
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
         TITLE 'Subroutines: GETPARAM - Get JCL Parameter'
***********************************************************************
* Registers on entry:                                                 *
*       R1  = address of parameter list                               *
*       R14 = Return address                                          *
* Registers on exit:                                                  *
*       R15 = Return code                                             *
*         0 : Parameter moved to PARMAREA                             *
*         4 : No parameter passed via JCL                             *
*       All other registers are restored                              *
*       PARMAREA: Text of JCL Parm                                    *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
GETPARAM DS    0H                     , Get JCL Parameter
         STM   R14,R1,GETPSAVE        , save all registers
         BLANK PARMAREA               , clear parm text area
         L     R1,0(0,R1)             , Address of passed parm
         LH    R15,0(0,R1)            , R15 = Length of parameter
         LA    R1,2(0,R1)             , R1  = Address of Parameter
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , If a parm is given
          OI   PROCFLAG,HAVEPARM      , indicate we have a PARM
          BCTR R15,0                  , decrement for EX
          MVC  PARMAREA(*-*),0(R1)    , move in parameters
          EX   R15,*-6                , via EX
          XR   R15,R15                , Indicate PARM read
         ELSE                         , no parm given
          LA   R15,4                  , Indicate in RC
         ENDIF                        , test if parm given
         ST    R15,GETPSAVE+4         , set caller's RC
         LM    R14,R1,GETPSAVE        , restore all registers
         BR    R14                    , and return to caller
         TITLE 'Subroutine OPENFILE - Open files as needed'
***********************************************************************
* Open a file, report any errors if open fails                        *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on entry:  R1  = address of DCB to be opened              *
*                      R14 = Return address                           *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on exit:   R15 = Returncode                               *
*                        0 ==> OPEN successful                        *
*                        8 ==> OPEN failed                            *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
OPENFILE DS    0H                     , Open routine
         STM   14,3,OPENSAVE          , save registers
         LR    R3,R1                  , Point to DCB
         USING IHADCB,R3              , tell assembler
         MVC   TEMPDDN,DCBDDNAM       , insert DD name into msg
         MVC   OCLIST,THELIST         , Set up open/close list
         IF    (CLC,DCBDDNAM,EQ,TUSPDDNM)         SYSPRINT?
          OPEN ((R3),OUTPUT),MF=(E,OCLIST)
         ELSE
          OPEN ((R3),INPUT),MF=(E,OCLIST)
         ENDIF
         IF    (TM,DCBOFLGS,DCBOFOPN,O) if open was successfull
          LA   R15,0                  , clear return code
         ELSE                         , when open failed
          MSGPUT MSG02E               , insert message body
          MVC MSG02E1,TEMPDDN         , insert DDname into message
          BAL R14,PUTMSG              , issue the message
          LA  R15,8                   , load error RC
         ENDIF (TM,DCBOFLGS,DCBOFOPN,O) if open was okay
         ST    R15,OPENSAVE+4         , set caller's R15
         LM    14,3,OPENSAVE          , restore registers
         BR    R14                    , and return to caller
         DROP  R3                 , not needed outside this module
         TITLE 'Subroutines: CLOPRINT - Close SYSPRINT if open'
***********************************************************************
* Close SYSPRINT if open                                              *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
CLOPRINT DS    0H                     , Close SYSPRINT if open
         IF    (TM,PROCFLAG,PRNTOPEN,O) close PARMDIR if open
          STM  R14,R1,CLOPSAVE        , save registers
          LA   R3,SYSPRINT            , point to DCB
          MVC   OCLIST,THELIST
          CLOSE ((R3)),MF=(E,OCLIST)  , and close it
          NI   PROCFLAG,255-PRNTOPEN
          LM   R14,R1,CLOPSAVE        , restore registers
         ENDIF (TM,PROCFLAG,PRNTOPEN,O) close PARMDIR if open
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
         TITLE 'Subroutines: CLOSYSIN - Close SYSIN if open'
***********************************************************************
* Close SYSIN if open                                                 *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
CLOSYSIN DS    0H                     , Close SYSPRINT if open
         IF    (TM,PROCFLAG,SYSNOPEN,O) Test if SYSIN is open
          STM  R14,R1,CLOSSAVE        , save registers
          LA   R3,SYSIN               , point to DCB
          MVC   OCLIST,THELIST
          CLOSE ((R3)),MF=(E,OCLIST)  , and close it
          NI   PROCFLAG,255-SYSNOPEN
          LM   R14,R1,CLOSSAVE        , restore registers
         ENDIF (TM,PROCFLAG,SYSNOPEN,O) close PARMDIR if open
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
         TITLE 'Constants'                                    '
THELIST  OPEN  (,),MF=L               , Open close RDJFCB list
         LTORG
         TITLE 'Reentrant Storage'
WORKAREA DSECT
***********************************************************************
* The description of a few variables has been placed here because     *
* IFOX00 doesn't easily allow certain forward references in the EQU   *
* statement.                                                          *
***********************************************************************
THEWTO   WTO   '----+----1----+----2----+----3----+----4----+----5----+-
               ----6----+----7----+----8----+----9----+----0----+----1--
               ---+----2----',MF=L
MSGTEXT  EQU   THEWTO+4,124           , area for message texts
PRNTLINE DS    0CL133                 , line to SYSPRINT
PRNTCC   DS    CL1                    , control character
PRNTTEXT DS    CL132                  , text to be printed
BSPOSCMD CSECT
         TITLE 'Constants - Report Header Lines'
**********************************************************************
*  BSPOSCMD Version 1.0
*
*          |l      _,,,---,,_
*    ZZZzz /,:.-':''  . -.  ;-;;,
*         |,4-  ) )-,_. ,( (  :'-
*        '---''(_/--'  :-')_)
*
*  Placed into the Hercules Domain
*  by Volker Bandke, BSP GmbH'
*
**********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
HEAD001  DS    0CL(133)
         DC    C'1BSPOSCMD Version &BSPVER..&BSPMOD'
         FILL  HEAD001                ,
         ORG   HEAD001+133-8
         DC    C'PAGE '
HEAD0011 EQU   PRNTLINE+133-5,3
         ORG   ,                      ,
HEAD0C1  DS    0CL(133)
         DC    CL60'0'
         DC    C'         |l      _,,,---,,_'
         FILL  HEAD0C1
HEAD0C2  DS    0CL(133)
         DC    CL60' '
         DC    C'   ZZZzz /,:.-'':''    -.  ;-;;,'
         FILL  HEAD0C2
HEAD0C3  DS    0CL(133)
         DC    CL60' '
         DC    C'        |,4-  ) )-,_. ,( (  :''-'''
         FILL  HEAD0C3
HEAD0C4  DS    0CL(133)
         DC    CL60' '
         DC    C'       ''---''''(_/--''  :-'')_)'
         FILL  HEAD0C4
HEAD0C5  DS    0CL(133)
         DC    CL60'0'
         DC    C' Placed into the Hercules Domain'
         FILL  HEAD0C5
HEAD0C6  DS    0CL(133)
         DC    CL60' '
         DC    C' by Volker Bandke, BSP GmbH'
         FILL  HEAD0C6
         DS    0CL(133)
         TITLE 'Constants - Error and status messages'
**********************************************************************
*   BSPOC01E - xxxxxxxx DD statement not allocated
*   BSPOC02E - Open failed for DD xxxxxxxx
*   BSPOC03W - No commands in PARM or SYSIN
*   BSPOC14E - Environment not BATCH or STC
*   BSPOC91I - Processing command: ccccccccc
*   BSPOC99I - Function terminated, highest RC=xxxx
***********************************************************************
MSG01E   DC    C'BSPOC01E - Allocation failed for XXXXXXXX, RC=XXXX, S9+
               9ERROR=XXXX'
MSG01E1  EQU   MSGTEXT+33,8
MSG01E2  EQU   MSGTEXT+46,4
MSG01E3  EQU   MSGTEXT+61,4
MSG02E   DC    C'BSPOC02E - Open failed for DD statement XXXXXXXX'
MSG02E1  EQU   MSGTEXT+40,8
MSG03W   DC    C'BSPOC03W - No commands in PARM or SYSIN'
MSG14E   DC    C'BSPOC14E - Environment not BATCH or STC'
MSG20I   DC    C'BSPOC20I - DD already allocated, no allocation done'
MSG91I   DC    C'BSPOC91I - Processing command: ----+----1----+----2----
               -+----3----+----4----+----5----+----6----+----7----+----8
               8----+----9----+----0'
MSG91I1  EQU   MSGTEXT+31,100
MSG99I   DC    C'BSPOC99I - End of processing, MAXRC=xxxx'
MSG99I1  EQU   MSGTEXT+36,4
         TITLE 'Reentrant Storage'
WORKAREA DSECT                        , reentrant storage
DBL      DS    D                      , Double word for CVB
ALCPSAVE DS    4F                     , ALCPDUMP Save area R14 - R1
ALCUSAVE DS    4F                     , ALCUDUMP Save area R14 - R1
CLOPSAVE DS    4F                     , CLOPRINT Save area R14 - R1
CLOSSAVE DS    4F                     , CLOSYSIN Save area R14 - R1
DOSVSAVE DS    6F                     , DOSVC99  Save area R14 - R3
DOWASAVE DS    8F                     , DOWAIT   Save area R14 - R5
ECHOSAVE DS    4F                     , ECHOLINE Save area R14 - R1
GETPSAVE DS    4F                     , GETPARAM Save area R14 - R1
GETLSAVE DS    4F                     , GETLINE  Save area R14 - R1
OPENSAVE DS    6F                     , OPENFILE Save area R14 - R3
OPNPSAVE DS    4F                     , OPNPRINT Save area R14 - R1
OPNSSAVE DS    4F                     , OPNSYSIN Save area R14 - R1
PUTMSAVE DS    6F                     , PUTMSG   Save area R14 - R3
PROCSAVE DS    4F                     , PROCLINE Save area R14 - R1
SETISAVE DS    4F                     , SETINIT  Save area R14 - R1
TEMPDDN  DS    CL8                    , for DDNAME
MAXCC    DS    F                      , returncode given to caller
MEMCC    DS    F                      , current RC
LASTCC   DS    F                      , current RC
DEVTYPE  DS    6F                     , for devtype macro
         DS    0D
SYSPRINT DS    CL(SYSPRLEN)           , reentrant DCB for SYSPRINT
         DS    0D
SYSIN    DS    CL(SYSINLEN)           , reentrant DCB for SNAPDUMP
         DS    0D
PARMAREA DS    CL100                  , Area for commands
RBPTR    DS    F                      , request block pointer
REQBLK   DS    CL(S99RBEND-S99RB)     , Request block
REQBLKLN EQU   L'REQBLK               , length of request block
SVC99WA  DS    CL100                  , parameter area for SVC99
SVC99P1  EQU   SVC99WA+0,4            , SVC 99 parameter 1
SVC99P2  EQU   SVC99WA+4,4            , SVC 99 parameter 2
SVC99P3  EQU   SVC99WA+8,4            , SVC 99 parameter 3
OCLIST   OPEN  (,),MF=L
PROCFLAG DS    XL1                    , Processing control flag
ISTSO    EQU   B'10000000'            , running as a TSO user
ISJOB    EQU   B'01000000'            , running as a batch job
ISSTC    EQU   B'00100000'            , running as a started task
PRNTOPEN EQU   B'00010000'            , SYSPRINT is open
SYSNOPEN EQU   B'00001000'            , SYSIN is open
HAVEPARM EQU   B'00000100'            , We have a JCL Parm
HAVESYSN EQU   B'00000010'            , We have SYSIN line(s)
LINENUM  DS    PL2
PAGENUM  DS    PL3
         BSPEND                       , of module
./ ADD NAME=BSPPA2SI 8000-74082-74082-1607-00557-00557-00000-HERC01
BSPPA2SI BSPENTER BASE=(R11),RENT=YES
         COPY  BSPGLBLS
         COPY  BSPSGLBL
         TITLE 'Main Processing'
         BAL   R14,SETINIT            , go for setup and init calls
         BAL   R14,ALCUDUMP           , go allocate SYSUDUMP
         BAL   R14,ALCPRINT           , go allocate SYSPRINT
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if Allocate worked
          BAL  R14,OPNPRINT           , go open SYSPRINT
         ENDIF                        , if not, use WTO instead of put
         BAL   R14,PROCPARM           , go analyse PARM statement
         IF    (LTR,R15,15,NZ)        , Was there a parm statement
          MSGPUT MSG03E               , load message text
          BAL  R14,PUTMSG             , send message to user
          SETMAXCC 12                 , set return code
          B    EXIT
         ENDIF
         BAL   R14,ALSYSUT1           , allocate SYSUT1
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , if SYSUT1 is not allocated
          MSGPUT MSG04E               , load message text
          BAL  R14,PUTMSG             , send message
          SETMAXCC 12                 , set RC
          B    EXIT                   , and leave
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)
         BAL   R14,OPSYSUT1           , open SYSUT1
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , open was okay on SYSUT1
          SETMAXCC 12                 , set a return code of 12
          B    EXIT                   , and leave
         ENDIF
         BAL   R14,WRITPARM           , then write PARM to SYSUT1
EXIT     DS    0H                     , Get out
         MSGPUT MSG99I                , insert message
         L     R15,MAXCC              , get return code
         CVD   R15,DBL                , make a number
         UNPK  MSG99I1,DBL+5(3)       , make printable
         OI    MSG99I1+L'MSG99I1-1,C'0' last digit printable
         BAL   R14,PUTMSG             , write last message
         IF    (TM,PROCFLAG,SUT1OPEN,O) close SYSUT1 if open
          LA   R3,SYSUT1              , point to DCB
          MVC   OCLIST,THELIST        , initialize OC list
          CLOSE ((R3)),MF=(E,OCLIST)  , and close it
          NI   PROCFLAG,255-SUT1OPEN  , indicate file is closed
         ENDIF
         IF    (TM,PROCFLAG,PRNTOPEN,O) close PARMDIR if open
          LA   R3,SYSPRINT            , point to DCB
          MVC   OCLIST,THELIST        , initialize OC list
          CLOSE ((R3)),MF=(E,OCLIST)  , and close it
          NI   PROCFLAG,255-PRNTOPEN  , indicate file is closed
         ENDIF
         L     R15,MAXCC              , get return code
         BSPRET RC=(15)               , and return with rc in r15
         TITLE 'Subroutines: SETINIT - Initialize some variables'
***********************************************************************
* Setup and Initialization                                            *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on Entry:  R14 = Return address                           *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on Exit:   unchanged                                      *
***********************************************************************
SETINIT  DS    0H
         STM   R14,R1,SETISAVE        , save registers
         BLANK PARMAREA               , clear parm text area
         ZAP   LINENUM,=P'100'        , force page break
         ZAP   PAGENUM,=P'0'          , Init page number
         MVC   THEWTO(AWTOL),AWTO     , init reentrant WTO area
         LA    R1,128                 , maximum length
         STH   R1,THEWTO+4            , put into reentrant WTO
         XC    MAXCC,MAXCC            , clear RC area
         XC    LASTCC,LASTCC          , clear RC area
         XC    MEMCC,MEMCC            , clear RC area
         XC    PARMFLAG,PARMFLAG      , clear parm flag
         XC    PROCFLAG,PROCFLAG      , clear parm flag
         TESTENV                      , STC? BATCH? TSO?
         IF    (CH,R1,EQ,=H'0')       , is this a batch job
          OI   PROCFLAG,ISJOB         , remember in process option flag
         ELSEIF (CH,R1,EQ,=H'4')      , is this an STC
          OI   PROCFLAG,ISSTC         , put indicator to flag
         ELSE                         , it is not supported
          BLANK MSGTEXT
          MSGPUT MSG14E               , insert message text
          BAL  R14,PUTMSG             , issue message
          SETMAXCC 12                 , indicate error RC
          B    EXIT                   , get out with RC=12
         ENDIF
         LM    R14,R1,SETISAVE        , restore registers
         BR    R14                    , and return to caller
         TITLE 'Subroutines: PUTMSG - Display an error message'
***********************************************************************
* Routine to display an error message. The error message is assumed   *
* to be stored in the MSGTEXT area (and is at most 124 bytes long)    *
* The messages will be written to SYSPRINT DD if available and open.  *
* If not, the messages will be isssued via WTO                        *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on Entry: R14 = Return address                            *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
PUTMSG   DS    0H                     , output message on sysprint
         STM   R14,R3,PUTMSAVE        , save registers
         IF    (TM,PROCFLAG,PRNTOPEN,O) SYSPRINT available?
          IF   (CP,LINENUM,GT,=PL2'55') end of page reached?
           MVC PRNTLINE,HEAD001       , Put in page header
           ZAP LINENUM,=P'12'         , reinit line number
           AP  PAGENUM,=P'1'          , increment page number
           MVC HEAD0011,=X'40202120'  , insert edit mask
           ED  HEAD0011-1(4),PAGENUM  , beautify page number
           PUT SYSPRINT,PRNTLINE      , write page header
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C1       , Insert LOGO1
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C2       , Insert LOGO2
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C3       , Insert LOGO3
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C4       , Insert LOGO4
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C5       , Insert LOGO5
           PUT SYSPRINT,HEAD0C6       , Insert LOGO6
          ENDIF
          BLANK PRNTTEXT              , erase any garbage
          MVC   PRNTTEXT(L'MSGTEXT),MSGTEXT
          PUT   SYSPRINT,PRNTLINE
         ELSE                         , no SYSPRINT, use WTO instead
          WTO  MF=(E,THEWTO)
         ENDIF
         XR    R15,R15                , clear RC
         ST    R15,PUTMSAVE+4         , set caller's RC
         LM    R14,R3,PUTMSAVE        , restore return address
         BR    R14                    , and return
         TITLE 'Allocate SYSUDUMP for JOB if needed'
***********************************************************************
* Allocate SYSUDUMP DD if not already present                         *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
ALCUDUMP DS    0H                     , allocate SYSUDUMP
         STM   R14,R1,ALCUSAVE        , save registers
         MVC   TEMPDDN,TUSDDDNM       , insert DDNAME into msg text
         MVC   SVC99WA(TUSDLEN),TUSDPTR move text units to WS
         LA    R1,SVC99WA+TUSDDDN-TUSDPTR  point to DDNAME
         ST    R1,SVC99P1             , put into TU list
         LA    R1,SVC99WA+TUSDCLS-TUSDPTR  , point to CLASS parm
         ICM   R1,B'1000',=XL1'80'    , indicate last parm
         ST    R1,SVC99P2             , put into TU list
         LA    R1,SVC99WA             , point to work area
         BAL   R14,DOSVC99            , go and do it
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , Error on DYNALLOC?
          WTO  MF=(E,THEWTO)          , tell the user
          SETMAXCC 4                  , and end with RC=12
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , Error on DYNALLOC
         LM    R14,R1,ALCUSAVE        , restore registers
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
***********************************************************************
* SYSUDUMP DYNALLOC parameters                                        *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
TUSDPTR  DS    0F                     , text unit pointers
         DC    A(TUSDDDN)             , address of DDNAME
         DC    X'80'                  , end of list indicator
         DC    AL3(TUSDCLS)           , address of SYSOUT CLASS info
TUSDDDN  DC    AL2(DALDDNAM)          , key for DDNAME
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(8)                 , length od 1 entry
TUSDDDNM DC    CL8'SYSUDUMP'          , contens of entry
TUSDCLS  DC    AL2(DALSYSOU)          , key for SYSOUT
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(1)                 , length of 1 entry
         DC    C'A'                   , sysout class
TUSDLEN  EQU   *-TUSDPTR
         TITLE 'Subroutines: DOSVC99 - Perform DYNALLOC functions'
***********************************************************************
* Allocate a file to the current JOB/STC using SVC99.                 *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on entry:  R1 --->  Text Unit parameter list              *
*      field TEMPDDN:  DDNAME to be allocated                         *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on exit:   R15 = Retrun code                              *
*                        0 : Allocation successful                    *
*                  nonzero : RC from DYNALLOC call                    *
*      field MSGTEXT: error message text                              *
***********************************************************************
DOSVC99  DS    0H                     , perform DYNALLOC functions
         STM   R14,R3,DOSVSAVE        , save registers
         LR    R3,R1                  , point to Text Unit Pointerlist
         DEVTYPE TEMPDDN,DEVTYPE      , Test for DD card
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,NZ)       , if no DD card
          LA   R2,REQBLK              , point to request block
          USING S99RB,R2              , tell assembler
          XC   REQBLK,REQBLK          , clear RB
          MVI  S99RBLN,REQBLKLN       , set up length
          MVI  S99VERB,S99VRBAL       , indicate ALLOC function
          ST   R3,S99TXTPP            , put into Request block
          LA   R3,RBPTR               , Point to RB pointer
          USING S99RBP,R3             , tell assembler
          ST   R2,S99RBPTR            , st RB address into RB PTR
          OI   S99RBPTR,S99RBPND      , turn on high order bit
          LA   R1,RBPTR               , get addres of RB pointer
          DYNALLOC                    , issue SVC 99
          ST   R15,DOSVSAVE+4         , set caller's R15
          XR   R15,R15                , clear R15
          ICM  R15,B'0011',S99ERROR   , get error code
          ST   R15,DOSVSAVE+8         , place into caller's R0
          MSGPUT MSG01E               , insert message text
          MVC  MSG01E1,TEMPDDN        , insert DDNAME into message
          X2CHRTRN MSG01E2,DOSVSAVE+06,LEN=2
          X2CHRTRN MSG01E3,DOSVSAVE+10,LEN=2
         ELSE
          ST   R15,DOSVSAVE+4         , set caller's R15
         ENDIF
         LM    R14,R3,DOSVSAVE        , restore return address
         BR    R14                    , and retrun to caller
         DROP  R2,R3                  , not needed any more
         TITLE 'Allocate SYSPRINT for JOB if needed'
***********************************************************************
* Allocate SYSPRINT DD if not already present                         *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
ALCPRINT DS    0H                     , allocate SYSPRINT DD
         STM   R14,R1,ALCPSAVE        , save the registers
         MVC   TEMPDDN,TUSPDDNM       , insert DDNAME into msg text
         MVC   SVC99WA(TUSPLEN),TUSPPTR move text units to WS
         LA    R1,SVC99WA+TUSPDDN-TUSPPTR  point to DDNAME
         ST    R1,SVC99P1             , put into TU list
         LA    R1,SVC99WA+TUSPCLS-TUSPPTR  , point to CLASS parm
         ICM   R1,B'1000',=XL1'80'    , indicate last parm
         ST    R1,SVC99P2             , put into TU list
         LA    R1,SVC99WA             , point to work area
         BAL   R14,DOSVC99            , go and do it
         ST    R15,ALCPSAVE+4         , set caller's retrun code
         LM    R14,R1,ALCPSAVE        , restore the registers
         BR    R14                    , and return to caller
         SPACE 2
***********************************************************************
* SYSPRINT DYNALLOC parameters                                        *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
TUSPPTR  DS    0F                     , text unit pointers
         DC    A(TUSPDDN)             , address of DDNAME
         DC    X'80'                  , end of list indicator
         DC    AL3(TUSPCLS)           , address of SYSOUT CLASS info
TUSPDDN  DC    AL2(DALDDNAM)          , key for DDNAME
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(8)                 , length od 1 entry
TUSPDDNM DC    CL8'SYSPRINT'          , contens of entry
TUSPCLS  DC    AL2(DALSYSOU)          , key for SYSOUT
         DC    AL2(1)                 , number of entries
         DC    AL2(1)                 , length of 1 entry
         DC    C'A'                   , sysout class
TUSPLEN  EQU   *-TUSPPTR
         TITLE 'Allocate SYSUT1 for JOB if needed'
***********************************************************************
* Allocate SYSUT1 if not already present                              *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
ALSYSUT1 DS    0H                     , allocate SYSPRINT DD
         STM   R14,R1,ALSYSAVE        , save the registers
         DEVTYPE =CL8'SYSUT1',DEVTYPE , just test if it is allocated
         ST    R15,ALSYSAVE+4         , set classer's retrun code
         LM    R14,R1,ALSYSAVE        , restore the registers
         BR    R14                    , and return to caller
         TITLE 'Subroutines: OPNPRINT - Open SYSPRINT'
***********************************************************************
* Open SYSPRINT DD for output processing (for a job)                  *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
OPNPRINT DS    0H                     , open SYSPRINT
         STM   R14,R1,OPNPSAVE        , save registers
         MVC   SYSPRINT,SYSPRDCB      , move DCB to reentrant storage
         LA    R1,SYSPRINT            , point to SYSPRINT DCB
         BAL   R14,OPENFILE           , go open the file
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if successful
          OI   PROCFLAG,PRNTOPEN      , indicate that SYSPRINT is open
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,Z)       , if successful
         LM    R14,R1,OPNPSAVE        , restore registers
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
         PUSH  PRINT
         PRINT NOGEN
SYSPRDCB DCB   DDNAME=SYSPRINT,       , ddname for this file           +
               DSORG=PS,              , file is sequential             +
               LRECL=133,             , record length                  +
               BLKSIZE=1330,          , and blocksize                  +
               MACRF=(PM),            , will be opened for output      +
               RECFM=FBA              , fixed block, ansi cntlchars
SYSPRLEN EQU   *-SYSPRDCB             , length of DCB
         TITLE 'Subroutines: OPSYSUT1 - Open SYSUT1'
***********************************************************************
* Open SYSUT1 DD                                                      *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE
OPSYSUT1 DS    0H                     , open SYSPRINT
         STM   R14,R1,OPSYSAVE        , save registers
         MVC   SYSUT1,SYSUTDCB        , move DCB to reentrant storage
         LA    R1,SYSUT1              , point to SYSPRINT DCB
         BAL   R14,OPENFILE           , go open the file
         IF    (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if successful
          OI   PROCFLAG,SUT1OPEN      , indicate that SYSPRINT is open
         ENDIF (LTR,R15,R15,Z)        , if successful
         LM    R14,R1,OPSYSAVE        , restore registers
         BR    R14                    , return to caller
         PUSH  PRINT
         PRINT NOGEN
SYSUTDCB DCB   DDNAME=SYSUT1,         , ddname for this file           +
               DSORG=PS,              , file is sequential             +
               LRECL=80,              , record length                  +
               RECFM=FB,              , record length                  +
               BLKSIZE=80,            , record length                  +
               MACRF=(PM)             , will be opened for output
SYSUTLEN EQU   *-SYSUTDCB             , length of DCB
         TITLE 'Subroutine OPENFILE - Open files as needed'
***********************************************************************
* Open a file, report any errors ifopen fails                         *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on entry:  R1  = address of DCB to be opened              *
*                      R14 = Return address                           *
*                                                                     *
* Registers on exit:   R15 = Returncode                               *
*                        0 ==> OPEN successful                        *
*                        8 ==> OPEN failed                            *
***********************************************************************
         SPACE 1
OPENFILE DS    0H                     , Open routine
         STM   14,3,OPENSAVE          , save registers
         LR    R3,R1                  , Point to DCB
